contextId.information: It is possible that the word "feet" here may have been a more respectful way to refer to the genital area of the body. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
Moses used a polite way of saying God was going to destroy the Egyptian army. AT: "For God will kill the Egyptians" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: For you will never see again the Egyptians

contextId.information: This is a polite way of talking about sleeping with their wives. AT: "do not sleep with your wives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: do not go near your wives

contextId.information: This includes things that a husband must do for his wife, including sleeping with her. AT: "and he must continue to sleep with her as before" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
Sleeping with someone is a euphemism for having sex. AT: "if he has sex with her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

Here "sleeps with a beast" is a euphemism that means someone has sex with an animal. This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must certainly kill anyone who has sex with an animal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Whoever sleeps with a beast must surely be put to death
